alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Muscogee; Stewart; Talbot; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 7:59AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marion, Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Stewart, western Webster and southwestern Talbot Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 759 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Seale, or 13 miles south of Phenix City, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Lumpkin, Buena Vista, Cusseta, Preston, Richland, Fort Moore, Weston, North Fort Moore, Bibb City, Upatoi, Brantley, Seminole, Green Island Hills, Juniper, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Oakland, Troutman, Sanford and Eelbeck/West Fort Moore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Marion; Muscogee; Stewart; Talbot; Webster
